result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Cane Bauman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

timeConds.notes: Full Huber. Stayed-Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by 09/26/2022 for report date within 60 days or no later than 11/20/2022. records.addlTxt: 8:41 AM Defendant Jesse Cane Bauman in court.  Attorney Scott K. Mccarthy in court for Jesse Cane Bauman.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 and 2. Court orders sentence withheld 2 years probation on each count with 30 days conditional jail on count 1. Full Huber. STAYED; defendant to call Diversion by 09/26/2022 and report to jail no later than 11/20/2022.  As conditions of probation, defendant is to complete any assessments and treatment recommended by DOC including anger management. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional. May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant is to complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary. Court orders restitution in the amount of $740 plus surcharges due COC collect. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 2 days.

9:02 AM Defendant Jesse Cane Bauman in court.  Attorney Scott K. Mccarthy in court for Jesse Cane Bauman.  Attorney David Zarwell in court for State of Wisconsin. Right to jury trial waived by defendant freely and voluntarily; State consent.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
